content.title: Internship Scheme Of Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO)
content.beneficiary: Students pursuing law or related fields
content.details: The Internship Scheme of Employees’ Provident Fund Organization invites applications for Internships from students for engagement as 'Interns' with EPFO. The 'Interns' shall have an opportunity to know about the EPFO’s functioning and Departmental Policy issues in EPFO and Government of India and contribute to the Policy/Legislation formulation by generating policy inputs such as empirical analysis, briefing reports, policy papers, etc. However, the internship is neither a job nor an assurance for a job in EPFO.
benefits: Logistic support including working space and computer with internet facility
Certificate of Internship upon satisfactory completion
eligibility: Pursuing law in the last two years of degree course or Law Graduates
Pursuing Post Graduation in Law or Research Scholars in Law
Enrolled in recognized University/Institution within India or abroad
content.application_process: Online application must be submitted in the prescribed format via email to rc.hrm@epfindia.gov.in.
documents_required: Letter of Recommendation from the Head of Institution
Permission Letter / No Objection Certificate from the Supervisor or Head of Department
Copy of documentary proofs of identity (passport, Aadhar Card, etc.)

faqs.question: Who Can Apply For The EPFO Internship Scheme?
faqs.answer: Students pursuing law in the last two years of their degree course, law graduates, students pursuing post-graduation in law, research scholars in law, and students pursuing post-graduation courses like MBA/MSW/MSc/MA from recognized universities or institutions within India or abroad are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: What Is The Objective Of The EPFO Internship Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective is to provide an opportunity for interns to learn about the EPFO's functioning, departmental policy issues, and contribute to policy/legislation formulation through empirical analysis, briefing reports, policy papers, etc.

faqs.question: What Is The Duration Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: The internship can range from a minimum period of 2 months to a maximum period of 6 months.

faqs.question: Will Interns Receive A Stipend?
faqs.answer: Yes, selected interns will be paid a stipend of ₹8,000 per month for the duration of the internship.

faqs.question: How Can Applicants Apply For The EPFO Internship Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must submit the prescribed application form via email to rc.hrm@epfindia.gov.in.
